intro: Sageretia thea var. bilocularis, commonly known as the two-chambered sageretia, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed fruits, which set it apart from other varieties of the species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories across parts of East Asia. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically intriguing but poorly studied species.
